Posts.Content: Just before my group run i went to the rest room and my urine was clear. However after a five mile run I went to the rest room again and my urine was full of blood (no lower ab pain). I was a nervous wreck so I went to the ER for evaluation and they determined that i had a Prostate infection (WBC and RBC in urine) and prostatic calcifications through a CT. During my wait in the ER i drink a couple of bottles of water and before the evening was over my urine began to clear and was back to normal. My urologist has been watching my PCA counts (3.6) and climbing. I had a biopsy a year ago and no detection of cancer cells. I have an appointment with my uro on Monday and I'm guessing I will be getting Cystoscopy soon. I'm very nervous why I had so much blood in my urine and I'm like to know if this is normal for this to happen with a prostate infection.
Posts.Title: Another blood in urine

Posts.Content: Thanks to everyone for the wonderful responses...I cant Thank you enough. My PCP did a full blood workover in July and that's how I discovered my elevated PSA. I called my Urology clinic once the results were in. My Urologist is out on vacation and his nurse consulted with another Physician at the clinic. He wanted me on Bactrim for thirty days and to retest before the cycle was over...not a day after. So I will retest in two weeks and have results to post in about three weeks. As far as I know I never had Prostatitis or any other infection related to the prostate. I'm not even sure what the symptoms are. My white blood count was normal so that could rule an infection out? Thanks again everyone!
Posts.Title: PSA increasing

Posts.Content: This is my first post since 2013. I'm hoping someone can help me understand what's going on with me. My PSA count in July 2015 was 4.9, a big jump from January 2015 at 3.0. I included below about an eight year history of my PSA counts. As you can see my counts have always been high for my age group. Earlier this month my doctor put me on Bactrim twice a day for thirty days and will retest me again in September. I have a feeling another biopsy is coming. Should I ask for an MRI first? I'm very active. I workout twice a day 5 times a week and I run a couple times a week. I been having a lot of lower abdominal pain, most of the pain happens when I run. It seems I have a lot of inflammation in my pelvic area and lower back area. Would this cause an increase in PSA levels? I stopped taking fish oil because I heard it can cause an increase. I'm very worried Date PSA age 7/15 4.9 49 1/15 3.0 49 5/14 3.6 48 9/13 3.6 47 3/12 3.2 46 free PSA 14% 4/11 3.4 45 7/11 biopsy 44 5/10 3.1 44 9/9 3.2 43 2/9 2.3 43 5/8 2.1 42 1/8 2.4 42
Posts.Title: PSA increasing

Posts.Content: I had a biopsy in 2011 at age 44, I didn't realize it was so long ago and it wasn't a very pleasant experience. I included my past PSA counts back to 2008. 04/2018 6.5 age-52 10/2017 3.7 age-51 03/2017 4.5 age-51 01/2016 3.5 age-49 09/2015 3.6 age-49 07/2015 4.9 age-49 01/2015 3.0 age-49 05/2014 3.6 age-48 09/2013 3.6 age-47 03/2012 3.2 age-46 04/2011 3.4 age-45 07/2011 biopsy age-44 05/2010 3.1 age-44 09/2009 3.2 age-43 02/2009 2.3 age-43 05/2008 2.1 age-42 01/2008 2.4 age-42
Posts.Title: MRI Results-- please advise

Posts.Content: I just got my MRI results back but I don't see my doctor until next week. I'm 52 years old and my last PSA came back at 6.5. My PSA seems to go up and down but this is the highest it has been. Findings Estimated prostate volume= 5.8 x 4.0 x 6.2 x 0.52 cm = 75 ml Peripheral zone Lesion size-- 5 mm Location- posterior left mid peripheral zone near the capsule texture--homogenous ADC signal intensity- mildly hypointense DWI signal intensity- isointense Focal and early enhancement- not present Extracapsular extension- not present Report Nuerovascular bundle invasion- No Lesion PI-RADSv2--3 Multiple hypoechoic circumscribed and heterogeneous encapsulated nodules typical of a benign prostatic hypertrophy Pelvic lymph nodes-- Normal Osseous structures- No mass or focal lesion IMPRESSION 5mm left posterior mid gland peripheral zone lesion, PIRADS 3 Multiple benign central gland nodules Moderate prostate enlargement 75ml

Posts.Title: MRI Results-- please advise

Posts.Content: Hello again, Thank you to everyone that has responded to my post. Reading through the forums has provided great information....I love the brotherhood. I realize I'm not in the same situation as most here but I have a feeling I maybe joining the club some day....probably much sooner than I hope. My Dad just found out that he has prostate cancer...He has the aggressive type. He's 74 and I don't think he's going to fight it. Once i learn more I will follow up. I had my followup appointment with my urologist concerning my MRI results. Going in I had prepared myself mentally for another biopsy but I was a little surprised that he wanted to wait three months and retest my PSA. He said the lesion that was found is a concern and we will be watching it closely. I'm still nervous about the whole situation and I would love to know what you think. Thanks again.
